meanings.definition: A conductor through which electricity enters or leaves an object.
meanings.sent1: The electrodes connected the battery to the light bulb.
meanings.sent2: The scientist placed the electrodes on the frog's legs to stimulate movement.
meanings.sent3: The electrodes decided to take a break from all the electricity flowing through them.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as electrodes, sparking inspiration in the hearts of her listeners.
meanings.sent5: The electrodes glowed brightly as power surged through them.

meanings.definition: A conductor used to establish electrical contact with a nonmetallic part of a circuit.
meanings.sent1: Carefully, she attached the electrodes to the plastic casing of the device.
meanings.sent2: The technician replaced the old electrodes with new ones to improve the connection.
meanings.sent3: The electrodes felt important as they bridged the gap between metal and plastic.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like electrodes, making everyone around him feel energized.
meanings.sent5: The electrodes hummed softly, signaling a successful connection.

meanings.definition: A terminal through which electric current passes between metallic and nonmetallic parts of a circuit.
meanings.sent1: The electrodes allowed the flow of electricity between the metal and plastic components.
meanings.sent2: Make sure the electrodes are securely fastened to prevent any disruptions in the current.
meanings.sent3: The electrodes were the ultimate mediators between the metal and nonmetallic elements.
meanings.sent4: The relationship between them was like electrodes, conducting energy and connection.
meanings.sent5: The electrodes buzzed with energy as they facilitated the transfer of power.
